data.text: Today, SWISS welcomed its third Airbus A320neo to its fleet. Aircraft HB-JDC has been named “Pontresina” after the beautiful mountain village in the canton of Graubünden. The SWISS fleet now numbers five aircraft of the advanced and fuel-efficient A320neo family. https://t.co/U6lIVSixz9
An exceptional year is coming to an end. We wish you a great start into the new year. 🥂🎊🎆 https://t.co/wv9km6yrD7

data.text: Corresponding return flights to Switzerland will only be available to Swiss and Liechtenstein nationals and the holders of certain resident statuses in Switzerland and Liechtenstein.

annotations.normalized_text: Swiss Federal Office of Civil Aviation

data.text:
SWISS to resume services to UK and South Africa. 
Passenger flights can resume from ZRH and GVA to the UK and South Africa from 00:00 on Thursday 24 December, the Swiss Federal Office of Civil Aviation has ruled. https://t.co/nCrtnWsvNd

Due to the new epidemiological situation, SWISS has suspended all passenger flights to and from the UK as well as South Africa with immediate effect and until further notice. Flexible rebooking options continue to apply for all SWISS passengers. More info: https://t.co/gV3XUfARUd
SWISS Flight Attendant Rebecca shared this beautiful shot from her flight from Geneva to Zurich. Isn’t it lovely? 🏔❄️ https://t.co/ZtILFZnqhE
Over the past six months, @SwissWorldCargo has been preparing for the transport of COVID-19 vaccines and is ready to execute shipments in the coming weeks and months.
This one goes out to everyone who misses travelling: “You’ll be back, flying through the skies.” SWISS Flight Attendant Nadja SWISSed up this famous Christmas classic for you. https://t.co/guFmdMKQnU

data.text: Have a happy weekend. ☀️ https://t.co/zBt44XUHo2

SWISS and all @staralliance airlines are working together, so you can #flywithconfidence. We are committed to the same health and hygiene measures designed to keep you, the crew, as well as your family and friends safe when you fly.

Thanks to everyone working in the aviation industry for contributing to safe and comfortable air travel every day. SWISS is proud to connect Switzerland with the world. #CivilAviationDay https://t.co/AlIxnzilFJ
Our Rudolph wishes you a happy Samichlaus Day. Are you celebrating St. Nicholas Day in your country? 🎅🦌 https://t.co/NkSSBfDoEa
🎶 Fly me to the moon… ✈️🌝 https://t.co/1oxZoSv8DY
As of now, we serve Fondue in SWISS First. Would you order one? 🧀 https://t.co/nE3UeBOdol
SWISS Flight Attendant Francesca will accompany you through the cozy month of December on our Instagram @flyswiss. ✨❄️

data.text: Plan your next trip worry-free: We are extending our free-rebooking offer. All SWISS fares with tickets issued up to and including 28 February 2021 can be rebooked free of charge as many times as you wish until then - and as of March, one further free rebooking remains possible.

From December until the end of May we will offer our guests in SWISS Business and SWISS First food creations from Canton Fribourg. The meals have been concocted by the head chef at the Romantik Hôtel L’Etoile in Charmey, with inspiration from modern French cuisine.

data.text: "We are not fighting for our survival, but for our future." SWISS CCO Tamur Goudarzi Pour spoke to 20 Minuten about variable salary components, the adapted food concept and the new normal for aviation: https://t.co/CgCjC6uDfP
We love you, Switzerland. ❤️ https://t.co/qrp7MdvgTb

After an eight month break, we are resuming flights to St. Petersburg with weekly operations on Fridays. SWISS flight LX1310 took off today at 07:37 with an expected arrival at 12:30 - It's good be back!   🇷🇺 https://t.co/8lTclasHxT
This week, our air cargo division @SwissWorldCargo carried out the first of several cargo-only flights to Santiago de Chile. 🇨🇱 https://t.co/tAQJueLIWs
We wish you a happy and cozy weekend. ✨✈️ https://t.co/amsSi9CpJf

Today is #WorldChildrensDay. For many years, SWISS has been collecting donations for the SOS Children's Villages aboard its flights. With your online-donation you can support children in need, also without flying SWISS. Thank you! 🌍💝

data.text: Are you a #mindfulflyer? As a @Miles_and_More member, you can easily offset your carbon footprint in the app.

Dieter Vranckx has held various management positions within the airline industry since 1998. He can also look back on some 20 years with the Lufthansa Group, including more than 13 years at SWISS and Swissair, respectively: https://t.co/vmOiI80e41

RT @SwissEmbassyUSA: Chief Commercial Officer of @FlySWISS, Tamur Goudarzi Pour & @SwissAmbUSA take a look at how #COVID19 has impacted the…
Are you fit to fly? The current flu season means for us to focus even more on protecting the health of our passengers and employees.
“Hello, is it me you’re looking for?” 🎼 https://t.co/ziytYnInrA

Since the beginning of the Coronavirus crisis, our cargo division @SwissWorldCargo has operated more than 1,000 cargo-only flights, transporting over 23,000 tonnes of goods. During April and May, we mainly transported medical products supporting the Swiss population and economy. https://t.co/zXE0DiDPh8

data.text: Juten Tach, BER. 👋 The first SWISS Flight LX970 landed at the newly-opened @BerlinAirport at 17:33 yesterday. #HelloBER https://t.co/eVnlDQEaCu

Welcome home HB-JPB. 🎉✈️ Our second Airbus A321neo named "Château-d'Oex" joined our fleet yesterday. The aircraft of the Airbus A32Xneo family are among the most efficient of their kind. https://t.co/EjhHSCrKaq
RT @CHBotschaftDE: Uf Wiederluege #TXL! Heute 🛫 und 🛬 zum letzten Mal eine Maschine @FlySWISS am Flughafen #TXL! #DANKETXL #schönwars #byeb…
SWISS and its kapers cabin crew union have agreed a package of actions for the airline’s cabin personnel in response to the present coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/QjwAxzhlas https://t.co/HX0izw3KsV

Guess the song 🎶:
The 🍃 drift by the window
The 🍂🍁 of 🔴 and 🥇
I see your 👄, the summer 😙
The ☀️-burned 👐 I used to hold https://t.co/au5SfAMEts

In view of the pandemic, SWISS’s operating loss increased to CHF 414.7m for the first nine months of 2020. Thanks to an increase in production in summer and substantial cost reductions, the Q3 operating loss was an improvement on Q2. https://t.co/qJyOzOTASg https://t.co/IMM93olHGu
☕🍫 Enjoy your chocolate moment onboard: For the perfect start into the winter season, SWISS is offering Swiss hot chocolate in all classes as of now. https://t.co/Gch0XdZwH3

data.text: The refund requests from customers dating from the same time period have also been processed. More recent ticket refund requests continue to be processed on a rolling basis, and October will see the processing times involved shorten further to their usual pre-pandemic levels. https://t.co/ygU9Dlgt0x

SWISS has completed by the end of September its processing of the ticket refund requests which it had received from Swiss tour operators up to the end of July, thereby complying with a corresponding requirement from the Swiss Confederation: https://t.co/yXHqZBizjf https://t.co/RvTZnMbmk5

🌍✈ SWISS keeps Switzerland connected with the world despite strict quarantine provisions. SWISS will be restoring several more destinations to its flight schedules from Zurich and Geneva in the coming 2020/2021 winter timetable period.

Thomas Klühr, SWISS CEO since 2016, is to leave the company at the end of 2020 after more than 30 years within the Lufthansa Group. The Board of Directors has acceded to his request with the greatest regret. For more information: https://t.co/ekFUHtpyfF https://t.co/q1NG3Cojf6

entity.name: Sesame Street
entity.description: A longtime favorite of children and adults, and a staple of PBS, "Sesame Street" bridges many cultural and educational gaps with a fun program. Big Bird leads a cast of characters teaching children numbers, colors and the alphabet. Bert and Ernie, Oscar the Grouch and Grover are just a few of the other creatures involved in this show, set on a city street full of valuable learning opportunities.

More free space on board? No problem. Just book the seat next to you for that extra bit of comfort:

SWISS took delivery today of its first Airbus A321neo. The aircraft, which bears the registration HB-JPA, has been named “Stoos”. With this addition to the fleet SWISS is further underlining its commitment to resource-friendly aviation. https://t.co/HXbnN8FY8O
In ❤ with our 🇨🇭✈ https://t.co/wwmrOvwZE0

We are happy that we were able to fly the women National Soccer Team to Zagreb yesterday. We are keeping our fingers crossed for tomorrow's European Championship qualifying match against Croatia. Hopp Schwiiz @SFV_ASF  ⚽🇨🇭 https://t.co/ks5t8ivsNH

data.text: Please follow our guidelines for wearing a mouth-nose cover on board our flights. We thank you for your cooperation.

Flexibility is key when travel plans change due to unforeseen circumstances. That’s why SWISS has introduced flexible fares for all new bookings until the end of the year. If you need to, you can change your new booking to a new date or destination without rebooking fees.

We are proud to be back: On 12 September, @SwissWorldCargo carried over 46 tons from Delhi to Zurich for the first time since March. LX147 was operated with one of our modified Boeing 777-300ER. https://t.co/5pPnCW7rDQ

SWISS CEO Thomas Klühr: "With the support of the EASA protocol, we are now further committing ourselves to the most rigorous aviation health safety standards. And we are convinced that, in doing so, we are helping to make air travel even safer in these challenging times.”
SWISS CEO Thomas Klühr: “We have continuously expanded our health safety precautions for our guests and our employees, in the air and on the ground, over the past few months."

SWISS commits to @EASA standards for safe air travel under pandemic conditions. We are committed to maintaining the most rigorous standards of protection against infection worldwide. In these pandemic times, the safety of our passengers and employees is our paramount priority. https://t.co/LJyZD6ogfd

data.text: As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, SWISS reported an operating loss of CHF 266.4 million for the first half of 2020. A total of 29,667 flights were operated, 59.5 per cent fewer than in the first half of 2019. Full financial report: https://t.co/OAS3kr6fVR
